metadata.title: CVE-2019-10899 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.4.0 to 2.4.13, 2.6.0 to 2.6.7, and 3.0.0, the SRVLOCdissector could crash. This was addressed inepan/dissectors/packet-srvloc.c by preventing a heap-based bufferunder-read.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10899` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.8-1
libwireshark12 - 2.6.8-1
libwiretap9 - 2.6.8-1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.8-1
libwsutil10 - 2.6.8-1
tshark - 2.6.8-1
wireshark - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-common - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.8-1').
